title: Electric Potential - objects on conducting paper

content.question:
Show all your work for each part of the the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A group of students have been provided with a setup consisting of a large metal ring of radius <math alttext="uppercase R sub uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math> and a small metal disk of radius <math alttext="uppercase R sub D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>D</mtext></msub></math>, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The ring and the disk have been placed on top of a sheet of partially-conducting paper. When the ring and disk are connected to a battery, each becomes a surface of constant electric potential, while the potential varies with location on the paper. As shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the potential difference between any two locations on the paper, including where the ring and disk are, can be measured by touching the two probes of a voltmeter to the two locations. The students also have a battery that makes a constant potential difference of <math alttext="9.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>.

(a) Describe an experimental procedure to collect data that would allow the students to determine whether the electric potential, when taken to be zero infinitely far from the disk, is inversely proportional to the distance <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the disk’s center. Provide enough detail so that the experiment could be replicated, including any steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.

The two new metal objects are placed on the paper in a way that produces a uniform electric field in one region of the paper, and the students wish to determine the magnitude of the electric field in this region.
